name: Movies of Michael Caine Quiz | Celebrities | 10 Questions

questions.text: Caine played the title role in "Alfie". Which statement best describes the character for most of the movie?
questions.explanation:
Playboy.

	Caine played a somewhat shallow and superficial ladies' man. The movie was a key role for him early in his career. (Dionne Warwick had a hit with the song, "Alfie".)

questions.text: Caine also starred in "The Ipcress File". What was the name of his character?
questions.explanation:
Harry Palmer.

	Palmer was a spy back in the days of James Bond when spy fiction was extremely popular. Bruhl was the name of the principal character in "Deathtrap". Urfe was the name of the principal character in "The Magus". Baker co-starred with Caine in "Zulu".

questions.text: Caine starred in "Funeral in Berlin". Who wrote the novel?
questions.explanation:
Len Deighton.

	This was also a spy novel that featured Harry Palmer. Le Carre is best known for "The Spy Who Came In From The Cold". Both Greene and Ludlum have many spy and adventure stories to their credit.

questions.text: Caine starred in the WW II thriller, "The Eagle Has Landed". The story involves a plot to kidnap what prominent figure?
questions.explanation:
Churchill.

	This is a nice, taut thriller ... despite the fact that we know from the get-go that the plot won't succeed.

questions.text: Caine had a key role in "The Cider House Rules". Much of the action in the story took place in an orphanage; where was it located?
questions.explanation:
New England.

	The memorable line from the movie is Caine's oft-recited: "goodnight, you princes of Maine, you kings of New England ..."

questions.text: Caine was one of the stars of "A Bridge Too Far", The story is about an actual event in what war?
questions.explanation:
WW II.

	Based on the bestseller by Cornelius Ryan, the movie describes an unsuccessful operation during World War II.

questions.text: Caine starred in "Sleuth". Who wrote the play on which the movie was based?
questions.explanation:
Anthony Shaffer.

	Anthony Shaffer wrote the masterful play .... but the brilliance didn't come across in the movie. I'm not sure why.

questions.text: One of Caine's more recent movies was "The Quiet American". Where did the action of the story occur?
questions.explanation:
Vietnam.

	Caine stars with Brendan Fraser in this tale of political intrigue set in Saigon.

questions.text: Caine starred in "The Magus". Who wrote the novel on which the movie was based?
questions.explanation:
John Fowles.

	The novel was a wonderful read; the movie didn't come close.

questions.text: Which of these movies does NOT include Caine in the cast?
questions.explanation:
Sliding Doors.

	"Doors" is a light comedy with Gwyneth Paltrow.
